{{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:CharacterTargetName}}, leader of the {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}} tribe has been defeated!

Your previous job has ended, yet the fate of your ex-client’s enemies is still in your hands.\n\nMaking peace with those who once opposed you in battle could even lead to them becoming your new employers, but you could also just put them out of their misery and finish them off once and for all!

Your recent occupation and transfer of a settlement belonging to {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}} to {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:SecondTargetFactionNameWithIcon}} has understandably angered the previous owner, and has caused the relations between these two factions to become deeply strained as a result. This is a reminder that such actions are not without consequences.

Your recent occupation and transfer of a settlement belonging to {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}} to {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:SecondTargetFactionNameWithIcon}} has resulted in a declaration of war upon the Asur! It should come as no surprise that your enemy has decided to pursue war in an attempt to recover their stolen territory. You surely now bare some responsibility to protect the territory else this all be for naught!

As your forays outside of his homeland grow longer, you must make a decision over the longer-term fate of your raiding party.\n\nYou could abandon the opportunity to sooner dominate the tribes of Norsca, and instead concentrate on the wider world’s fruits of conquest. Yet, following in Losteriksson’s footsteps and forging a new path from these Lustrian shores may prove more risky than fruitful.

It is no simple thing, exacting an honest confession from the pallid lips of a Druchii. They loathe their fairer kin far more than they fear death at their hands. It takes a stomach of unusual resolve to break one who has lived under the paranoia of the Witch-King and the sadism of his vile mother, and known nothing but suffering since birth. Few Asur would even try.

"I have told you all I know," the Druchii corsair sneers. His Elven beauty has been shattered by the blows of your fists, remade into something better reflecting the broken soul beneath. "The Lords of Clar Karond seek a trove of ancient treasure buried somewhere on the coast of Ulthuan. I do not know where it is. I do not know what it is supposed to contain. We had been summoned back to the Underworld Sea to learn more. That is all the captain told me, I swear it.”

You believe him, and for that reason alone, you are merciful. A knife to the heart is a kindness the Druchii scarce deserve. You wipe bloody hands on pure white robes and calmly sheathe the blade. “Bring in the next…”

This broad-keeled titan was amongst the last of the Dragonship to be built, the Anhara Draconis forest in which Starwood once grew having sunk with the Sundering of Ulthuan. She may lack Kalendirian’s seasoning, but there is a sprightliness in her timbers that brings a smile to all who see her. Here is a ship with a keen wind in her sails, and who still remembers the feel of springtime in Nagarythe.

"I have seen the Ravenships gathering at Karond Kar," the young Admiral confides to you in private. "More ships than I have seen on the water since the Witch King laid siege to Lothern and sent his assassins for the Everqueen. Their fleets are already gathered. They wait only for better weather."

The news is as grim as you feared. The attack on Ulthuan may come within weeks.

This battle-marked behemoth earned her scars during the War of the Beard, shattering the Dwarf navies and famously sinking the flagship of Barak Varr. The Asur may have lost the war and spent millennia withdrawing from their colonies in Elthin Arvan, but the weathered craft has continued to patrol the Black Gulf, a standing insult to every Dwarf whose ancestor she left in the Bay of Wrecks.

Her white-haired Admiral nods grudgingly across the water as his Dragonship passes alongside yours.

This is where the Asur and the imperfect younger races differ. Duty to Ulthuan always comes before pride.

Festooned in coloured silk, pennons snapping in the ocean breeze, this crescent-hulled leviathan is an uplifting sight. It was she who first took Aethis the Poet's representatives to Cathay, and ever since she has served as a grace and favour yacht for the Phoenix King’s ambassador to the court of the Sea Dragon. Look beyond the groaning timbers and the silk finery, however, and there is an old warrior there still.

Her dour-looking Admiral looks only too pleased to be at sea once more. "The Druchii are cowards and pirates. They will attack from the north, far from Lothern, where the Norscans have left the realms weak."

You fear he is correct. You wish you could know for sure.

A hush descends over the entire fleet as Indraugnir glides through the picketing lines of Falconships. A legend to Druchii and Asur alike, she was the first of her kind to ply the world’s oceans and secure the naval hegemony of Ulthuan.

So openly disdainful is her Ithilmar-clad Admiral that he refuses to dirty his boots on Kalendirian’s deck, obliging you to call upon him. For the chance to step aboard so storied a vessel, you can overlook a little arrogance.

"I have seen the Druchii scouting the islands north of Tor Anlec. If I did not know that the ruins of Nagarythe have been picked clean, I would have thought they were looking for something there..."

With a piercing shriek, a Great Eagle descends from the clear blue of the sky to alight upon your deck. Her pinions sag with exhaustion, having flown day and night from Tor Koruali to reach you. It is the news you have been waiting for. A large force of Druchii has landed in the islands to the north of the Shadowlands. A fierce thump of her wings, and the Eagle is aloft once more, returning to the defence of her beleaguered realm.

The party of Shadow Warriors leads you deeper into the cave. The partially flooded entrance was at the heart of the Druchii camp, and your twisted kinfolk died to the last to keep you from it. By your grim-faced guides’ flickering torches, you gaze around in wonder at the unexpected trove. You had been expecting gold, gemstones, a weapon from the time of Aenarion, but nothing nearly so precious as what you find. The remnants of a storehouse from before the sinking of Nagarythe, and inside it… 

Starwood. Enough to build the first new Dragonships in a thousand years, and ensure Asur dominion of the sea for millennia to come.

Your lips curl into a smile. The Witch King will rue the day he led you here.

Elven nobles are no strangers to ambition. However, those who seek to reap its rewards but stay out of the front lines do well to temper it with deference.\n\nOne such youth has been shadowing you during official functions… Until he finally comes up to you bearing a missive from one of his patrons in half-apologetic tones: your rival has found your stewardship wanting. For the good of Ulthuan, you must cede it to them.

Elves carry the Sundering in their hearts forever – yet some do so only as a means to quicken their pulse at Aenarion's feats against the hordes of Chaos. A rival Lord has employed one such fellow to challenge your held patronage for not being exacting enough of the realm's military capacity. This bold pronouncement was surely spurred on by a promise of a generalship or other.

You are approached by a noble of Eataine, famed for his even-handed, prudent governance and knowledge of all of Ulthuan's realms. He admits that a rival Lord – though he does not offer a name – has set their sights on a patronage you control, though he has decided to offer you his personal views as well.\n\nHe acknowledges your contributions to this realm... before providing a litany of your shortcomings in matters of patronage. He is doubtful you can make up for these deficits in between your other important duties.

The designated bearer of courtly bad news has had his eye on your controlled patronage for some time. Neither his lineage nor his martial prowess recommend him, but he amply compensates for it by his bullish demeanour. Such courtiers are as unpleasant as they are often necessary.\n\nYou know what he means to tell you before he does: "You must cede this post. There are other patrons more worthy. You have failed in your duty." Both your disposition at this moment and your standing allow you to swat him down, if not just for the rival Lord whom he speaks for.

The Phoenix King's generosity is not merely material. His famed even-handedness extends even to the members of his retinue which insist on dissenting at every opportunity. In truth, there is only one such man, though his persistence in opposing the King on even the smallest matters has become legendary.\n\nIn fairness, he has been right enough times to not be lightly dismissed. And so, when he tells you to forego this realm's patronage, you catch yourself wondering... is he right?

Some consider the lack of judgement a species of wisdom. For centuries, one of the Phoenix King's trusted advisors has eschewed the judgemental tendencies of his kind, judiciously applying himself to supporting the ruler of Ulthuan with no regard for advancing his own agenda.\n\nYet, when he comes to you, it is apparent the agenda he conveys is neither his, nor that of the king, strictly speaking. It is a rival Lord, who has managed to challenge a held patronage with a few select words.

There are those among Elven nobility who hone their political dexterity, compensating for their otherwise heavy-handed approach to governance. Few of them rise to true prominence, but always seem to find their place in the lower echelons of power.\n\nThe one with whom you currently maintain a somewhat strained working relationship has latched onto a rival of yours. He tries to displace your hold over a patronage seat, but is also amenable to cutting a deal that would benefit him specifically, instead.

Accommodating the great Elven Lords in political matters is not easy. This is why some nobles busy themselves with practical governance, not concerning themselves greatly with the ebb and flow of ephemeral courtly favour.\n\nAt first, it appears this one – a renowned expert on land and naval logistics – has made a rare exception. He bears someone else's demand that you vacate a held patronage, and personally will take on any required recompense. In the end, you realise he considers the business impact on his endeavours one of the main shortcomings of your efforts.

The proof of an Elven noble's worth is an astute combination of practical results and leveraging one's reputation – or that of one's lineage. With an overabundance of the former and a severe lack of the latter, a fiery young courtier has been tasked by a rival Lord to machinate your giving up of a patronage position. With that, he hopes to either gain a patron, or make a name for himself in supporting his benefactor's patronage of this realm.

Elves consider holding a grudge crass. However, slights may be redressed with finesse and well-calculated diplomatic jabs over long periods of time. You are sure this noble is the type to keep a list of those who offended him, which may double as an official census of Ulthuan's nobility.\n\nHe has decided to delicately vent his dislike by conveying a rival Lord's roundabout request for you to give up a patronage position in favour of someone more "reputable". The envoy may have contributed that part of the rationale himself.

[[i]]High Loremaster,

A troubling message has arrived from Ulthuan.

Some of our disciples speak of strange occurrences within the White Tower. At recent gatherings of the High Mages, guests became unaccountably erratic after but a few cups of wine. Quiet symposia devolved into unseemly revels, and students have taken to dressing in extravagant fashion, with whispers of secret meetings held beneath moonlight. One acolyte even claims to have glimpsed a Daemonic presence stalking the shadowed gardens!

We fear the hand of the Dark Prince may be at work within Saphery. Your wisdom is required.[[/i]]

The leader of {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}}, {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:CharacterTargetName}}, has been defeated. Their followers look on in horror, the unwavering belief in their leader dashed in an instant, even this legend cannot deny your supremacy amongst all Norscans now. Surely now is the time to offer them an alliance, when it would be foolish to refuse. Or, you may free them... as an insult perhaps, an unending torment for this foe - the choice is yours.

As a black portent flung from the firmament, a maelstrom of vile clamor and beating wings descends upon the stilted triad of stretched carrion, laid out in fleshly supplication to the gods. A raven of grotesque proportions, blotched and swollen with some nameless plague, settles upon the sharpened peak of the crude effigy and croaks, shrill and dire, fixing you with its rotted countenance and eyeless pits.\n\nWith one fevered strike of its sabre beak, it rends a heavy scrap of flesh, proffers it to you – and waits.

Of late, the many-faced Eagle has left the fevered bounds of your dreams, its shadow moving in formless accord with your own. You first glimpse it in the wild rush of the rapids, treacherous and chill as death. Then another visage, mirrored in the mire of sodden earth, trampled by the reaving horde and black as their souls. At last, a third winged shape – utterly strange – glimmers in the prism of a spider’s net, heavy with its doomed catch.\n\nHis rite weighs upon you like the storm cloud that veils Him from sight.

Separated from the marauding host, you stand alone beneath the endless sky and glimpse, upon the horizon, a solitary hound. It looms in dire triumph over its kin – throttled and torn, the loosened earth awash with blood and offal. The beast raises its muzzle from the final carcass to meet your gaze; a gory maw glistening with life’s last warmth, its black onyx eyes alight with cruel knowing. In their dark gleam your reflection stirs, savage and unrestrained, a murderer heedless of loyalty or reason. And in the beast’s silent, bared grin, its offer is made plain.

Like a whisper faint upon the edge of perception, Her copper-scaled shimmer had long been your silent companion beneath the wan light of day. Yet the unspoken edict of the Serpent ordains this hour, within the clasped stillness of night. Beneath the chimeric glow of the guttering flame, Her bluish-green patina darkens to the colour of earth, scarcely perceptible among the furs.\n\nHer opiate coils beckon you to Her side, where – entwined about your throat for a breathless confession – you shall bear witness to your utmost devotion.

Your hunters have waded into the midst of a severe snowstorm – shards of ice, as sharp as they are brittle, swirl around the advance troops. Mercifully, whatever force has whipped the ice into its impermanent fury has moved on, and the blizzard's momentum is dying out. Still, the message it spells out is obvious: this was Frigustrex's doing.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Of Frugistrex's frigid tempests, there is no trace – but his swirling Chaotic miasma remains. And not just that. Indiscernible shapes prowl the stretch of waste he once inhabited. Surely they would not have survived if they were not in some way favoured by the dreaded Frost Dragon.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Among the curiously skull-shaped rocks and snow-laden gusts, the hunting party spies another group. The strangers are examining the place, unhappy to have lagged behind their quarry, and unhappier still to see your warriors catch up with them. \n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Frozen escarpments, cold-cracked stone underfoot. Nothing in the sky, nothing on land. Nothing. For once, not even howling winds – though you think the air carries a hint of cruel laughter.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of blood frozen in the vein-like cracks of cave-walls, and tattered, yellowed flesh hanging in glittering icicles off its ceiling. You have found the cave, yet nothing awaits you there. The blood, however, is a vein of precious minerals. The icicles are amber.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

Temporarily disorientated by a sudden blizzard, the hunters see a number of their own peel away with a significant portion of supplies. As one of them turns, you belatedly realise they are strangers.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

You come across a Chaos monolith, cracked by the land's forbidding cold – or maybe by the freezing snap brought upon by your quarry's force. The stones crackle with rime-ridden magic.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man's beard is rimed with frost but otherwise he seems unaffected by the ubiquitous cold around him.{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

These lands lend themselves easily to tracing your quarry's path. Some of the signs are the same as those of a regular animal's passing presence – and some are signs of how that animal may have somehow changed from its normal form.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The current inhabitants have followed their pack leader here, but have apparently decided to settle and carve out their own hunting grounds. They make no attempt to hide – near-mindless they may be, but their malice more than makes up for it.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, hacking at a nearby grove in frustration at having missed their chance. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

A grove, a brook, a pair of soft-silhouetted clouds and their cool shadow on the ground, all deceptively peaceful... Wait. It *is* peaceful. How disgusting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of a once-peaceful hamlet in the throes of your target's rampage. You hurry to it, hoping to catch the monster by surprise... But you only find the hamlet, still peaceful, unsullied by violence. You will make sure to correct this inaccuracy. Throes and rampage there *will* be – and spoils.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

Distracted by looking for the almost-animal tracks of your quarry among the many other animal tracks on these lands, the hunters fail to notice a human presence shadowing them. The stalkers turn out to be neither that cunning nor strong, but they steal away with a significant portion of your supplies, nevertheless.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

At the bottom of a grassless hollow loom bestial totems – some of crumbling stone, some of surprisingly durable clay, all of them mocking the animal shapes that inspired them. On their surface, the hunters spy claw-marks and signs of bludgeoning.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man walks back and forth along a trail of bodies leading to – or does it lead from? – a small nearby grove. His white bird alights on a hawthorne branch, a severed eye in its beak. {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

The Shaggoth's passing presence has left the air strangely clear, filled with a fading high-pitched keening. This is a place from which the hunt can continue, but not the place where it ends.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The air is charged with electricity, overpowering any other errant gust of Chaos which haunts this place. Mighty creatures will no doubt be drawn here by the residual energies of the Shaggoth's passing... In fact, mighty creatures have already started gathering.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A band of Chaos Marauders, rather the worse for wear, take turns bellowing challenges to the sky, taunting it to strike them down with Chaos lightning if it dares. Then they turn their attention to you, taunts at the ready.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Those moaning heaps of rocks... could they be the creature you're after? The magic-charged miasmas all around... Could they be its baleful emanations? No. The Chaos Wastes are simply being their usual nightmarish self.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of challengers battling your quarry's Chaotic might amidst the Wastes' malicious vagaries. Though they fail, they leave it weakened – easy prey. The Seers were somewhat right: you stop at a corpse-littered valley of crackling obsidian. But it appears to have been a battle so one-sided that the monster apparently passed onwards without a second glance. Gear and supplies lie strewn around the battlefield.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

The hunting party has not encountered a living soul in a while. The mutable land has taxed the attention of your scouts and confounded your Seers' sight. You barely have time to react when a ragged, sore-ridden band of humanoids appears seemingly out of nowhere and snatches whatever supplies are in reach.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

You come across a strange growth in the wilderness – not news in itself given your surroundings. But it appears to taper off into tendrils of Chaos energy, as if a Chaos rift has tried, and failed, to form.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The miasmic emanations of the Wastes seem to be making strange detours around the old man while he surveys the scene.{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

The land is blanketed in webs and cocoons, and the surface seems devoid of other life – either it has been devoured or carried off to feast on later.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Rivulets of water chitter along the stones. Stray strands of light catch strands of a different kind – glistening spiderwebs. Suddenly, the water is not the only thing that chitters, and the glisten of spiderwebs is broken by the glisten of bodies running along them.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

An armed band of trackers and pathfinders scramble along the rocks, looking for signs of the beast's passage. Some lean on weapons they probably hoped to use before learning their target had eluded them. Noticing your hunters' approach, they lift their blades, considering their chances.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

At your destination, the hunters are met with nothing but their surroundings' scornful  silence. Here and there a long-dead animal breaks up the monotony, but they seem to have died of hunger and despair at their harsh environs rather than killed by your quarry.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of murky yellow eyes glinting in the night, ensnared insects, a hidden lair... In the end, the Seers are somewhat vindicated. The insects trapped in eye-like globs of amber will offer no battle, but they do offer some reward. \n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

The Brood Queens's pursuit exacts a gruelling attention to detail from the hunters. Sometimes, the deadly arachnids leave a clear trail. Sometimes, the signs are all but imperceptible. The effort has distracted you enough that a scampering collection of thieves has carried off some of your supplies.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

A bare, lonely rock juts at the spot where you were expecting to meet the Brood Queens in battle. A webwork of runes criss-crosses it, but there the resemblances to spiderwebs end.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}

Blorgar seems to be long gone, but the destruction left in his wake is evident. Both the cursed land and the cursed air of the Chaos Wastes tremble with the aftershocks of his outbursts.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Here, the dizzying profusion of unnatural malice that flourishes across the Chaos Wastes has been pared down to a one of its most basic manifestations – a monstrous drive towards destruction. As if Blorgar left something of his inner self on the very Winds... along with something else. Monstrous bodies take shape in the middle distance.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

At an arcane crossroads marked by the knotted currents of Aqshy, Shyish, Ulgu and Chamon, shades of creatures who have never lived and molten metal streaming into incandescent humanoid shapes wander aimlessly. A band of hunters, much like yours though smaller, grumble at having missed their target – and at your forces arrival.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Blorgar seems to be long gone, but the destruction left in his wake is evident. Both the cursed land and the cursed air of the Chaos Wastes tremble with the aftershocks of his outbursts.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_05}}

The broken remains of a rickety camp wall and its habitations lean drunkenly against each other. The Chaos Wastes are the enemy of permanence. Blorgar, doubly so. But the remaining inhabitants' tenacity – or stupidity – is apparently invincible, and pointed right at your baggage train. Some of the thieves manage to get away, too.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

A monolith of astounding size stands alone in an otherwise barren, unremarkable field, as if the Waste's unnatural emanations have halted to provide more space for its presence. It is tilted – was an attempt made to tear it down?\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_08}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_01}}

The loud tearing of the earth and the crashing sounds of wood all around your hunters are a far cry from the hallmarks of a secretive Forest Dragon (the most secretive of all, in fact). Yet there is nothing else here felling the trees. It is the trees themselves, rising up.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, wandering among a magical grove. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, pretending they were not hopelessly lost a moment ago.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

A grove, a brook, a pair of soft-silhouetted clouds and their cool shadow on the ground, all deceptively peaceful... Wait. It *is* peaceful. How disgusting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed their way into Radixashen's dreams... or so they claim. The claim to know his plans, his weaknesses. And his location? As soon they start speaking of it, they wander off into the forest, all in different directions, mumbling under their breath. You send people to trail them, but soon they return: no sign of the Seers. Instead, they carry armfuls of strange, gleaming wood, precious though slightly sinister in form.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

You come across a strange collection of men, half-naked, all mad. They think they have been here since the beginning of time. They think themselves the ancestors of the elves, or trees, or Dryads. Apparently, they also think themselves thieves. A band of them use the general confusion to steal away with some of your supplies as the rest melt away into the woods.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

You reach a dead tree in the otherwise thriving forest. The magic in it is palpable but it is not that of the Elves – it carries a tinge of Chaos. Fresh striplings already grow around it, as if to fend off its dark presence.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man walks back and forth along a trail of bodies leading to – or does it lead from? – a small nearby grove. His white bird alights on a hawthorne branch, a severed eye in its beak.{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

Trampled scenery is the hallmark of the migrating Mawherd, but in the Frozen North snowdrifts conceal what little there is to trample. Still, some of this land carries signs of their passage. It must have happened not long before.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The Mawherd seems to have stopped here, milling about for some time before moving on. What could the reason have been? Soon, it becomes clear – a wounded member of the herd has stayed behind. "Enfeebled", you might call it, were it not a gargantuan, ill-tempered Mammoth which has caught sight of the pursuers.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_03}}

Not a single fleck of snow is undisturbed. Ice gleams pristinely. A side-trail reveals some tracks – not Mammoth. In fact, their size and length of stride indicate something rather shorter than a man.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_06}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_08}}

There is nothing – just a grove-strewn, peaceful-looking plain. It is enough to make the hunters doubt the Shrieker's very existence, were it not for their hackles inexplicably rising as they scour the place.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The silence still carries vestiges of the Shrieker's call, driving high-pitched needles of sound into the hunters' ears. It is enough to distract them from the sound of wings unfurling, like leathery curtains being pulled aside. The air comes alive with glittering eyes set in fell darkness.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, hacking at a nearby grove in frustration at having missed their chance. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Neither bloodcurdling screeches nor lingering dread. The scariest thing around is the occasional hunter cursing at the root snagging his foot or at some song-bird's mating call.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_05}}

You stop under a patch of forest canopy while your scouts survey the sky on its outskirts, straining their ears for the tell-tale signs of the Shrieker's call. Suddenly, shadows sprout around the unattended baggage train, and whisk some supplies away. As they clear the grove, your realise the thieves are human.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

A strange arrangement of skeletons has occupied most of a shallow hollow on the plain you have been scouring. The sides of each skulls, where the ears would have been, are crusted with dried blood. The Dark Gods' presence is palpable in this otherwise peaceful place, even in broad daylight.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}

This seemed a likely place to catch the Mother of Flame unawares as she appeared on this side ot the mortal veil – but it seems that has not happened yet. Ther are, however, glimmerings in the air…\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Something roars. It is not the sea, for it does not roar with the singular ill-intent these voices carry – neither does it let its glittering white spume prowl the earth in the shining lion shapes that face your hunters.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A rival band of hunters has apparently followed a trail around the isles that got them to this spot before you. The sea-spray on their armour and faces, however, seems only to exaggerate their angry disappointment at having missed their appointment with your mutual quarry.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

There is the faraway surf and the nearby trees and meadows whose disgustingly Elvish, almost garden-like appearance beg to be despoiled.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of the Mother of Flame's rebirth. Liquid fire on parched earth... The sun shimmering on her feathers... Frustratingly, their advice seems to lead you closer to the sea than any live volcano. At sunset, their dream is made real: a high tide reddened by the sun's descent spills on the parched sand. Light shimmers on a nacreous outcrop, vaguely phoenix-shaped. At its base: pearls.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

On the slopes of a dormant volcano, the site of one of the Mother of Flames previous incarnation, your path is blocked by a ragged band of what look like Norscans – old, haggard and screaming defiant obscenities. You slaughter them confusedly – only to realise they were a distraction. Others have carried off a portion of your supplies!\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

The Blighted Isle is where the presence of Chaos is felt most strongly on Ulthuan. Yet here, too, a hush seems to have descended on the land. The sea is quiet, and the ground feels brittle – consecrated to the Dark Gods, surely. Yet even as you scour the place, an otherworldly spark-like glimmer rides the air, muting its malicious aura.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man seems to be listening to the echoes of a faraway surf while the white bird battles for supremacy of the skies against a flock of tattered seagulls.{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

The hunters reach a vast swath of vegetation, flattened into mulch by Gargantulzan. The jungle is still, as if intimidated into silence by the titanic creature.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Gargantulzan's places of rest are markedly absent any signs of civilised Lizardman presence – they know better. Feral beasts also keep well away from its company, for it is enough to boil even Cold Ones' blood with terror. But once the titan has moved on... those same Feral Cold Ones return again – as they now do.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A rare clearing in the midst of choking vegetation and its colourful, poisonous fauna, reveals a rival band of hunters, rather the worse for wear. It seems they almost managed to surprise the monster – and maybe it is better that they did not, considering their current state. Noticing your forces, they are torn between militant anger and hope.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

You can swear you have been here before. The scouts assure you that this leaf or that tree-trunk are a different shade of some glaring colour, but none of them bear a trace of Gargantulzan's destructive stride.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of a vast, ruined temple. A beast of titanic size has made its lair there. Gargantulzan! You find the temple, and the beast. Titanic – no doubt about it. Also dead for centuries if its pillar-like bones are any indication. Still, the temple holds unplundered treasure.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

Any trail that this land's open spaces reveal is quickly obscured by the heaps of foliage it leads to, swallowing even Gargantulzan's tracks. The hunters' curses, however, seem to provide an easier lead. As you stop to rest, you discover your supply train is significantly lighter. Thieves! Not Lizardmen, either, for you spy their retreating backs... Norscans?\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

You had not hoped to stand in the palpable presence of Chaos in these lands, infested as they are by the reptilian puppets of Order. Yet Gargantulzan's mindless fury hews close to something you know all too well. Its latest ravages have left an old, ruined temple... well, even more ruined. The devastation feels somehow comforting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man is squinting curiously at a poisonously colourful amphibian in a nearby pond, its surface streaked with blood. {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

The hunters have stopped at the shore of a lake  - formerly frozen, now a churning swamp crawling with dirty ice and foetid vapour. The Beast was certainly here, but no longer.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Another day, another piece of frozen terrain mulched to stagnant, stinking slush – an obvious trail, at least. Here, it seems to have also left a decrepit Bray Shaman and a few Bestigors, performing some manner of inscrutable, unspeakable rite… Until they notice you.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_03}}

Frozen escarpments, cold-cracked stone underfoot. Nothing in the sky, nothing on land. Nothing. For once, not even howling winds – though you think the air carries a hint of cruel laughter.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of a swamp littered with broken ice, a multitude of bestial heads half submerged, watching... In the end, the heads reveal themselves as remnants of a long-ago battle. It seems both sides decimated each other. Their loot is mostly lost in the foetid depths, but enough of it lies scattered along the shore to be worth the effort of collecting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_06}}

You follow the trail to another of the Beast's swamps. This one seems to be almost dried up. A gigantic Hydra skull juts from the shallow muck, some of its vertebrae still attached. A shimmer of dark power, concentrated on the skull, enlivens the dank despondency of this place.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_08}}

You come across a field where rock and ice are interspersed with glittering Warpstone shards – an unnatural blight at odds with the terrain's mundane desolation. It is but a trace of your quarry – though one that can be followed.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The skittering of things unseen stops you hunters short – or was it an illusion conjured by scattering rocks? No, there is more – it is not your quarry, but a danger it left behind.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_03}}

As much as you pray to the Dark Gods for a hint of the Hellbeast's Chaos corruption, there is none of it in sight. Just the sights and sounds all Norscans are all too familiar with from birth.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_05}}

Temporarily disorientated by a sudden avalanche, the hunters see a number of their own peel away with a significant portion of supplies. As one of them turns, you belatedly realise they are strangers.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_07}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man looks to be waiting for someone. It may be your hunters. There's certainly nothing of note amidst the desolate landscape, and he does not pay much heed to the corpses strewn around him. {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

There is no sign of the Chimera - just wayward flurries of Chaotic energy, carrying intermittent echoes of its roar. But maybe it is enough to continue the pursuit.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Trudging through the Chaos Wastes, the hunters have skirted a number of skirmishes in their pursuit of the Chimera, to the displeasure of some of the warriors. Now, however, a skirmish seems to have found you, in the form of a small warband.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A band of Chaos Marauders, rather the worse for wear, take turns bellowing challenges to the sky, taunting it to strike them down with Chaos lightning if it dares. Then they turn their attention to you, taunts at the ready.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Those moaning heaps of rocks... could they be the creature you're after? The magic-charged miasmas all around... Could they be its baleful emanations? No. The Chaos Wastes are simply being their usual nightmarish self.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of voices screaming in dissonant unison  sweeping the land, rising up to the sky... After a time, you draw near a broken concourse flanked by fluted screaming columns. Their half-sentient voices raise dust from shattered flagstones. Some are embedded with gemstones.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

The hunting party has not encountered a living soul in a while. The mutable land has taxed the attention of your scouts and confounded your Seers' sight. You barely have time to react when a ragged, sore-ridden band of humanoids appears seemingly out of nowhere and snatches whatever supplies are in reach.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_08}}

The eldritch malice of the Chaos Wastes carries trace of the monster's passing. The landscape's malleable horrors seem to have assumed some of its aspect, enough to create the illusion that it may be nearby.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The eldritch malice of the Chaos Wastes carries trace of the monster's passing. The current trail, however carries something more – footsteps filled with Nurglish seepage. Soon after, you come across their owners, foul in mood and… all else.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

At an arcane crossroads marked by the knotted currents of Aqshy, Shyish, Ulgu and Chamon, shades of creatures who have never lived and molten metal streaming into incandescent humanoid shapes wander aimlessly. A band of hunters, much like yours though smaller, grumble at having missed their target – and at your force’s arrival.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

You pass the entrail-soaked aftermath of a Hound warband; the fluted, half-organic rock-formations bearing the Serpent's mark; the crystalline mirror-shards of the Eagle, showing one's back when one faces them... Where is the Crow's mark, where is his monster?\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_05}}

The hunting party has not encountered a living soul in a while. The mutable land has taxed the attention of your scouts and confounded your Seers' sight. You barely have time to react when a ragged, sore-ridden band of humanoids appears seemingly out of nowhere and snatches whatever supplies are in reach.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

You arrive at the edges of a fast-growing suppurating mass of... something. Things both living and unliving seem to compose it by decomposing in a manner you could almost call deliberate. Surely, there is some of the Crow's intent here, but also a Chaotic, haphazard manner more akin to that of your prey.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_08}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_01}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_02}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_03}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_04}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_06}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_20_decoy_dilemma_01}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_02}}

The unnaturally amplified echoes have served you well in tracking the quarry by sound. But it also has the capacity to confound hunters, and so it has lead you down the wrong path - as it clearly did another band of hunters. They seem understandably angry.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_03_decoy_dilemma_04}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_02_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_06}}

A bare, lonely rock juts at the spot where you were expecting to meet your foe. It is unmarked, edges dulled with time. Yet as one of your Seers touches it, he collapses, overcome with what he later describes as "the look of eyes which sting with deadly poison". \n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_11_decoy_dilemma_08}}

Both the vegetation and the open spaces of this place carry a trace of restlessness – shivering foliage, trembling air, as if something is about to take shape at any moment, or split them apart. But no, it has already done so, and moved on.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The current inhabitants have followed their pack leader here, but have apparently decided to settle and carve out their own hunting grounds. They seem in the grip of more than their usual near-mindlessness. No wonder, considering what you hunt. But it also seems to have redoubled their malice.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, letting their frustration out on a nearby murky puddle. They stop their stomping to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Across the landscape's variety or monotony, either the Jabberslythe has masterfully concealed its tracks, or it has stolen your scouts' sanity as they backtrack endlessly, foaming at the mouth at their failure.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers dream... and go mad. They disappear along a switchback trail. You follow them, expecting to find the Jabberslythe at the end of it. They suddenly reappear, claiming to have slain the monster bare-handed upon a nearby rise... They have not. But they have uncovered a sizable haul of ivory.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_06}}

As you near a strangely twisted grove in your path, the landscape starts to shift mesmerically. Lush jungles and barren savannahs flicker back and forth, while the stunted trees before you stay the same. After a time, the effect ebbs enough to approach them.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_09_decoy_dilemma_08}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_01}}

The current inhabitants have followed their pack leader here, but have apparently decided to settle and carve out their own hunting grounds – for fear of being eaten should they keep following the Ghorgon, no doubt. But now *they* are hungry. And you are here.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, adding axe-marks to the teeth-marks the Ghorgon left on some nearby tree trunks. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

A grove, a brook, a pair of soft-silhouetted clouds and their cool shadow on the ground, all deceptively peaceful... Wait. It *is* peaceful. How disgusting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_06}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}

Thus far, you have answered these harsh lands' every challenge. Indeed, seeking out trails where their smouldering ill-intent is almost palpable is how you have tracked the creature thus far. This time, you felt it closer... But you have lagged behind yet again.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The unyielding landscape has found its match in your quarry, who has turned it to molten, simmering sludge. But it seems another party has followed that trail as well – a band of ill-tempered Chaos Dwarfs more interested in the sludge than what created it. And now, they have become interested in *you*.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

At the edges of a smoking crater, your party comes across a handful of wild-eyed warriors wiping soot and sweat off their skin, trying to climb out. They have obviously undertaken the same hunt you have, and almost beat you to the punch. Heat and frustration have made them quite disagreeable at first glance.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

A brush fire fans the flames of your blood. Surely!... No. It is a brush fire. At any rate, your quarry's path would burn more than brush – more than almost anything, in truth.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of the Bull bursting apart in molten pieces, its roar fading... Following the memory of that fading roar, they lead you to a barren field. At its centre is a heap of gold nuggets, some of them still warm to the touch. It appears the monster ran headlong into a gold vein, and here is where it shook itself off. The gold is some consolation, at least.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

Apart from the unfamiliar climate, the Darklands are something fierce Norscans would come close to calling home. It may have been the reason why your hunters have let their guard down – and why others have made themselves comfortable enough to conceal themselves and gain the upper hand in raiding your supplies train!\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

The very air in this place flows and feels like hot liquid on your skin. Molten mirages flicker in the distance. A faraway fire melds with a faraway roar, and the crack and rush of the land giving way before the overbearing heat sounds like the stomp of faraway hooves. The unreality of the scene makes you think that this place carries some of the Dark Gods' touch.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man kicks at a patch of smouldering grass. Sparks fly upwards in the shimmering air. The white bird squawks in protest. {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_01}}

The current inhabitants have followed their pack leader here, but have apparently decided to settle and carve out their own hunting grounds – except they have fallen under the sway of a group of Dark Elves who have decided to make them their pets. Now they seem intent on siccing them on you.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Instead of the monster, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, angrily stacking stag-corpses they mistook for the Preyton. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

A grove, a brook, a pair of soft-silhouetted clouds and their cool shadow on the ground, all deceptively peaceful... Wait. It *is* peaceful. How disgusting.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_06}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}

The Dragon Ascendant has left traces of his passage, as if almost deliberately – massive claw-marks in the rocks, the biting vapours of its breath in the air that even the cold cannot dispel... and the irksome impression that it is goading your hunters on, taking its time.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The hilltop where the Ascendant waited, then moved on – probably watching the advancing hunters all the while – is now crawling with ragged-looking Dark Elves, come from who-knows-where. They may have not sought out the Black Dragon to slay it but rather to worship it.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A rival band of hunters have apparently been tramping across flat tundra and scaling sudden escarpments with a lot more alacrity than you have. They must have amused the Ascendant, for he has eluded them easily, though not as easily as he has eluded you.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

Your Seers assure you that the clearest sign of imminent battle would be the palpable scorn of the Ascendant's regard, even if you don't see him. But the only palpable thing here is your scouts' growing frustration.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_00_decoy_dilemma_05}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_11_decoy_dilemma_06}}

A mighty avalanche shudders through the earth beneath your feet. A likely occurrence in these parts, yet you feel intent behind it. The fallen ice-crusted stones form strange shapes, almost reminiscent of an altar.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_11_decoy_dilemma_08}}

The Runt's reverberations are neither sounds nor quakes, but the thundering echo of a primeval terror stamped on the soul of all mortal beings. Following the twist in their gut, the hunters have drawn closer, but not close enough yet.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

You have pressed on in pursuit of the Runt despite these lands unwitting attempts at killing you. It was a only a matter of time before it provided something that targeted you specifically. Some of your warriors are relieved to see the small cohort of Skinks in your path. After all, warriors is what they were before they were hunters.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

It looks like another band of hunters beat you to the punch… then decided not to deliver it. Looking at their force, they would probably have been wiped out by a saurian half the size of the Runt. That realisation seems to have spoiled their mood.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

The Runt's feet leave craters. His body leaves ravines. His maw leaves… well, nothing. Here, there *is* nothing. But not the proper kind of nothing.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers dream of a monster so vast even their dream-minds cannot fathom it. Then they dream of a monster not as vast but still gigantic. As the hunt wears on, they dream of smaller and smaller monsters, assuring you it is a sure sign you are on the right track. What you find when their dreams stop is a platform where dozens of miniature Runts, carved of precious stones, have been placed as offerings. Offerings they will be - to the hunt.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

The ease with which you follow the Runt's recent trail amply compensates for your unfamiliar surroundings. Soon, your are served with a bitter reminder that being caught up in an easy chase always exacts a price. A band of brigands has raided your largely unprotected supplies, and is gaining distance!\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_09_decoy_dilemma_08}}

The desert here has stretches of hardpan embedded with bone-dry vegetation… and bones. Among them, avian tracks that should not be as big as they are. Surely, they are the Carrion Eater's. But the sky above is clear of its shadow. It has moved on.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

Apparently, the hunters have idly kicked one bleached bone too many in their progress across the desert. A gust of wind reveals skeletal shapes rising from the sands. These bones look ready to fight back.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

A band of rival hunters, somewhat more appropriately attired for these sweltering climes than yours, sift through sand and kick at half-buried ruins in frustration. Apparently, they were much closer to catching up with the beast than your forces were.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

More featureless sky. More featureless sand. The speck on the horizon your scouts have followed may have been nothing more than encroaching sun-blindness.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of a sandstorm whose path you must follow to finally catch up to the Carrion Eater. What the gusts of gritty sand reveal instead is a long-buried structure, a massive statue of a Carrion perched at the top. A tomb? No. A treasure vault. After you are done here, you will tear down the statue, just in case.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

You make your way through a massive maze that looks to have been one of those garish, impractically huge cities Nehekharans were so fond of. As you are about to leave it, it turns out someone has managed to make use of its confusing, sand-buried bulk. A half-starved crowd of men emerge from the dunes and take off with some of your supplies in train.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}

Given the ancient Nehekharans' predilection for self-glorification, it is strange to come across a piece of land sanctioned to the Dark Gods. How did this happen? Were they always watching? Nevertheless, the ruin in front of you exudes a supreme, effortless superiority that is at odds with the Tomb Kings' bluster. How could the Carrion Eater be connected to all of it?\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_7_generic}}

{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_1}}The old man is shadowed by a ruined arch, his feet not quite touching the blood-soaked sands all around. {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_8_generic_2}}

Nothing in the vicinity bespeaks the presence of the Wise One. Absolutely nothing – a strange sense that not only was it not here recently, but it never was. Which, of course, means the opposite.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_1_generic}}

The hunters have learned that many backwater temples have been graced by the Wise One's passage. You have delivered your own form of grace to them in turn, the people of this one included. The statues, however, have taken exception to that treatment, and would return it.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_2_generic}}

Your quarry is not here. Instead, your hunters meet what looks to be a band of their counterparts from another tribe, hacking at a nearby grove in frustration at having missed their chance. They stop to eye your party calculatingly, testing their blades against their thumbs.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_3_generic}}

You make sure to disturb the harmony of your surroundings sufficiently to invoke some glimmer of the Wise One's disapproval which you can follow. Then you do it again, and again – to no avail.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_4_generic}}

Your Seers have dreamed of The Wise One's growing weariness with your pursuit, and the place where he will make his last stand - a temple whose guardian it may have once been. It turns out the Seers may have ascribed their own weariness to the beast in their dreams, for he is not here - just a handful of old monks and a large collection of jade offerings. Soon the monks are as dead as their precious stone, and the stone is at your disposal.\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_5_generic}}

The area you reach is curiously disturbed. It would have been uncharacteristic of the Wise One, had it not been for the column of tracks left by those who have tasked themselves with protecting him. Too late do you realise that it is not the only sign of inharmonious presence you should have been aware off. A ragged band of thieves, quite uncharacteristic of this place, has targeted your supplies and managed to sneak away with some of them.\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_dlc27_nor_monstrous_arcanum_decoy_dilemma_6_generic}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_07}}
{{tr:dilemmas_localised_description_wh3_dlc27_nor_monster_hunt_01_decoy_dilemma_08}}

A sullen note creeps into the revels of your hunters' army. Camaraderie is replaced by murderous glares over the fires. With the beast still not in sight, the warriors' excitement at facing it is replaced by the dull, slow-grinding anticipation of facing yet another slog, following vague tracks.

A hunt this may be, but it is no ordinary one, and neither are the setbacks one encounters. Much as the Dark Gods have sanctioned this endeavour, at times their capricious will acts to test your warriors' resolve.\nA night falls, then melts away... and with it, it seems, so have some of your own forces. Where? Only Crow and Eagle, Hound and Serpent know.

Keen senses and portentous premonitions guide your hunters' path – even when there seems to be none – yet it is bodies that must follow it. Though your warriors have not lost sight of the goal, their flagging strength belies their determination.

The hunt may have taken a wrong turn somewhere. A hunter may have made a blasphemous remark. Whatever the reason – and it may be for no reason at all – the Dark Gods are displeased.\nAn eagle circles overhead, unseen though radiating inscrutable ill-will. Hounds bay across the outer darkness. Crow's eyes glitter at the edges of the campfire, their beaks glistening with black rot. Serpents slither slyly through the flames.\nWhatever you are prepared to give to appease them, they may take more than what they provide in return.

Your hunt is, of course, a preordained success – of that you have no doubt. Others have not been similarly blessed or well-prepared. One such hapless reminder has taken ragged human form in front of the hunters' force. Half-mad, he barely remembers what it is he and his warriors once hunted – only that they failed.\nStill, his fingers twitch around the grip of his weapon, eyes bearing down on anything in sight to fight and kill – a cloud, a rock, the Winds themselves... or, as it happens, the hunting party's leader. You.

Any monster hunter knows that sooner or later the Dark Gods will make it known that they are watching. Though often the evidence of that is mysterious, this time it is as literal as they come – an altar, whose appearance is frustratingly reticent in disclosing its allegiance. Maybe it honours all of Dark Gods?\nAnd the offering already on it – is it a gift from them, to be taken? Something to be complemented by an offering of your own? Or something to simply pray upon?

Your hunters' progress is halted as they enter an unfamiliar patch of land – one which exudes the miasma of those regions that gird the Chaos Wastes.\nYou make your way through what looks like an ancient battlefield curiously devoid of remains though rife with strange weapons and armour, some of it thrumming with power. The air itself seems to carry some of that power, should one would stop and breathe deep the memory of carnage.

A key thing a monster hunt requires from the would-be hunter – a surplus of predatory tenacity. However, should their shortcomings prove insurmountable, the hunt is doomed, even if the hunters may not realise it.\nThe members of a rival band have apparently discerned as much, as they now stand in front of your warriors, their resolve unquenched, though tempered by reality. They seek a way to be of use.

A key thing a monster hunt requires from the would-be hunter is cunning opportunism. However, a surplus of it may suggest stratagems prone to inadvertently cutting one's own throat rather than that of one's rivals, especially among the Norscan tribes.\nSome such hunters, more opportunistic than cunning, have decided to lure away your warriors and use them in their pursuit. It was the wrong move indeed.

As your hunters scour the land following their quarry's tracks, a ragged host follows their progress, closing in. Like gathering clouds, their ill-intent darkens at the edges of the army. \nEither out of fear or some morbid reverence for the beast you pursue, they seem keen on striking directly at the head of the force. Some are picked off, but others use their superior knowledge of these lands to finally achieve their Ruinous goal.\nThe leader lies in tatters, surrounded by the corpses of the would-be assassins!

Triumph and failure are not the only two outcomes of a monster hunt. Some simply abandon it. Though this certainly is not true for your warriors (yet), they come across a tribe who have exchanged single-minded pursuit for opportunistic plunder. They have learned much of these lands and are not averse to sharing its secrets – provided those are paid for.

Your Seers have dreamed of a strange procession greeting you on your way along the monster's trail: the hunters' own mirror images, insubstantial yet irrefutably there – having returned, apparently, from a triumphant conclusion to the very hunt that is now underway, and very much not yet concluded.\nThe doppelgangers' forms exuded savage jubilation, dragging the monster's remains behind them. Though the cavalcade of eidolons faded with the dawn, the tale has imparted much of their victorious demeanour to your hunters.

Feet shuffle. Camp fires play on faces fixed into grimaces of boredom. Each passing day is greeted by an unsteady chorus of irritated growls. Whatever sort of hunt this was, it resembles one less and less as time goes.

The Dark Gods's whims may have lengthened your search in the past, but now the hunters' wits and bodies have been honed and bolstered by tempers grown increasingly short. Carnage is at hand. The warriors are raring to go!

A palpable scorn binds the rocky height, where loathing stretches from end to end.

At its foot, the stone sinks into a mire of worm-churned rot and stifling corruption. Within that noisome circle lies the swollen carcass of a raven, a totem sprawled upon the brink between suppuration and death’s decay.

High upon the naked crag, a solitary eagle crests the horizon – its outline a shifting spectre of form and omen. The clouds above hang low and brooding, their shapes ever-changing, ever dire.

Each of these eternal foes whispers of treasures beyond the wildest avarice – unknowing that your allegiance is sworn only to the thirst for dominion.

On the clearing’s far edges, the Destroyer and the Tempter stand opposed – their mutual hatred made manifest.

Beneath Morrslieb’s wan and fevered light, the Hound moves as a predatory shade, hauling behind it a grotesque braid of bone and cartilage – the fused remains of unnumbered prey. As it drags its spoil, new carrion joins the heap, while pale bones fall away in its wake to pave a butcher’s road.

Within the bramble’s shadow coils the Serpent, revealed only by fleeting gleams and the undulating whisper of scales upon the verdure – faint as breath, yet the most beguiling sound ever to reach your ear.

Each eternal adversary promises wealth beyond measure for your fealty to their realm – neither knowing that your allegiance is forever unbound.

Until now, most Trolls that trudge out of the wilds into your camp have simply looked to kill and eat whatever’s in front of them, not knowing who you are – so have been swiftly dispatched. But your recent ascendancy has given Trolls across the land a visceral awareness of your intentions, rousing them to march for your cause.\n\nThose nearby migrate aimlessly – you need only to choose whom to beckon forth.
A large parade of lesser Trolls lumbers just out of view of your camp. Weak, starved and leaderless, they would be easy – and useful – to bend to your will.

Amid the suffocating pall of incense and the dying glow of braziers, the seer, half-buried within the sundered chest of the sacrifice, appears as a grotesque offspring of a gate wrought from bone and sinew. His eyes, milky and sightless, indifferent to the feast of flesh, rise to meet yours with dreadful lucidity. In the rattle of his breath you sense an inchoate summons, bidding you trace the omen across the cartilage and scattered organs he charts with trembling fingers. Where do the portents lead the reaving horde?

At first, the hulking silhouette in the distance fills you with dread.

Then you hear the creature's laboured shouts and see the skein of Chaos magic around it. It is but a lone Khornate zealot – the blessings of his god seem more like crippling encumbrances and his skin is festooned with misshapen canine skulls welded into the flesh. Amused, you let him near.

Amidst the clacking of skulls and his breathless wheezes, he delivers a semi-coherent challenge on behalf of his Lord that you stop listening to halfway through, your attention drawn by the faraway, unseen presence of something large and ill-humoured near the supposed location of this wretch's warband.

Your latest drawing from the well of Chaos magic carries the aftertaste of all-too-familiar rot. You are certain you are safe – yet the virulence reveals itself soon after. Some among your warriors have concealed a brewing plague in the ranks, mistaking it for a blessing from the Crow. It is no such thing... yet. To keep these fools close would be a gamble, and you don't like gambles unless you are certain you will win.

Infamy inevitably breeds enemies. Making war on them is something you have made your peace with a long time ago. Yet those who would take your reputation as an example to follow can be much more bothersome to deal with – especially with this recent slew of silver-tongued aspirants invoking the name of a "Dark Prince".\n\nThe suspiciously Southerner-sounding title notwithstanding, they seem to have gained a foothold in your ranks. And unlike these little snakes' tentative converts, you know *exactly* whom they are talking about, and you will have none of it.

Recently, you have become aware of a shifting skein of magic being woven by Shamans across your camp – subtly, they think. Unfortunately, your last ritual has made it bloom in changeful, unexpected patterns. Not good. This would court the attention of one out of the Four whose attention you do *not* want on you.\n\nIs their work supposed to be a beacon for some enemy force lurking nearby? Something more complex? Against your better judgement, you find yourself intrigued...

Someone is hunting you... Or likes to think so.
